oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from John Wesley Teague to his father
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Letter from John Wesley Teague to his father. Teague discusses whether or not he should purchase land. He states that if his father wants to buy the land he will furnish him sixty dollars. Teague served as a messenger with the 9th Tenn. Vol. Cav. Regt., USA. He was fatally wounded at the Sunset Park Dam in Athens when his horse fell. He is buried in the Federal cemetery in Chattanooga. The letter is framed with another from Teague. The second letter is written to his wife and dated March 8, 1864.
